isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 5000, 9300 AND 9400 SERIES - ADJUSTMENT

svcsubsecinfo.para: To assure correct clutch operation and a long service life of clutch components, the clutch and the clutch control linkage must be properly adjusted.
Two types of adjustments must be made:
Adjustment factors are the release bearing to clutch brake clearance (clutch internal adjustment), the clutch pedal height and the release shaft yoke to release bearing clearance.

important.para: Do not change external (linkage) adjustments without first checking the clutch internal adjustment.

note.para: Changing the external adjustment will not compensate for an improperly adjusted clutch.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The following procedures cover only external linkage adjustments.
Refer to the specific clutch section in GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for internal adjustment procedure.

Some clutches have a self-adjusting feature which automatically compensates for wear of the clutch disc facings. However, initial settings must be established by manual adjustment at the time of clutch or clutch control linkage service.
To obtain proper clutch control operation, it is important that adjustment operations be performed in the following sequence:

item.para: Check the clutch internal (release bearing) adjustment and readjust if necessary. Refer to specific clutch section in GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Check the clutch pedal adjustment and readjust if necessary.

Check the clutch release shaft yoke to release bearing clearance (clutch pedal free travel) and readjust if necessary. Refer to RELEASE SHAFT YOKE TO RELEASE BEARING CLEARANCE
.

svcsubsecinfo.para: After all adjustments have been made, operate the clutch pedal and check the clutch release and clutch brake operation. The clutch should fully release and the clutch brake should be applied before the clutch pedal contacts the cab insulator panel.

step1.para:
Check the clutch pedal height ( Figure 2). Refer to SPECIFICATIONS
, for proper pedal height dimension.
If necessary, remove the sound insulator panel and adjust the pedal stop to obtain specified pedal height. Install the insulator panel.
